text: Did you happen to clone the blog content module?

woah, I’m guessing you need to lock the module in your template?

Seems like it’s treating the blog content module like a normal module
The Documentation for repeating fields is a little lacking.  FYI.
Yes … I was asked to
so created a new blog template and when tried to edit the listing/post i was asked to clone because read only
also, the featured images are not pulled on  the live blog … and i have a rich text module inside the post section that i can’t edit
also the rich text editor for the blog content is inaccessible … wherever I click is highlighting the title, which is right above the body
can I make a screenrecording for you showing you all this?
Please do.

Hey Adrian - we're actually going to prevent the cloning of the blog content module for this reason, it leads to a bunch of gnarly issues later on. When you tried to edit the listing/post did you use the buttons under the "post templates" section in the right sidebar? it sounds like you opened the actual custom module file itself
i’m making a video explaining everything
I need to launch this website redesign in a week :disappointed:
Yeah a video would be great, thanks!
Is anyone having issues with Scripts in the new HTML + HUBL on the new design manager. On an old version of HS it works fine but on the new version its not working any ideas
can you describe the issue?
I will send you a dm
this is going to be the link to the video: <https://youtu.be/nsGKZHvjhM0>
if you give it 10 min so the high resolution becomes available
awesome thanks!

Yeah we are going to be pushing some changes in a bit that do not allow you to clone the Blog Content module. Would it be possible for you to swap out "2018 Blog Content" for the standard "Blog Content" module that comes with any blog template? If you use that that should hopefully fix any of these issues. It would also prevent it from showing up in the lefthand sidebar when you're on the "Edit Blog Post" view so content creators wouldn't see it.

I am also about to push some changes that would prevent you from editing a HubL field in a custom module in the module editor
But i need to edit the blog content the listing and blog view

I need to edit the blog content … remove things that the client doesn’t wanna show … like links to author profiles or the blog summery and add my own code, like that riche text module which they insist on heaving

Can you not already do that from the template? Do you mean you'd want to edit the post and listing like this? <https://cdn2.HubSpotqa.com/hubfs/99180873/Screen%20Shot%202018-03-28%20at%2010.56.22%20AM.png>
yes
so if i add a rich text module in there, will it show up and be editable on the edit blog page
so that fixed one issue … the use a rich text snippet inside the Post or Listing Template does not work
video again: <https://soapbox.wistia.com/videos/OSbochwBZU> This was before you showed me the above screenshot
but still relevant for the rich text snippet i mentioned above
looking at the rich text issue
but otherwise are you able to update the Post/Listing templates for the blog content module?
I was able to add a rich_text module in a blog content post template in my own portal and it seems to be working ok, is that still not working for you?
send me the code you used for adding the rich text plese
Moving this to DM
IF you have a module built in DM2, anyone know if it can be added to a page using a DM1 template without converting the template?
found out the answer by doing - DM2 modules do not appear to have any problem being added to DM1 template pages
Is there still a Hubl module to Add in DM2 for raw Hubl code?
They only exist from DM1 templates converted over but can’t see a way to add one in DM2.
“Custom Hubl” module
you've got two options: create a custom module or use a coded template
3. Clone a Custom Hubl module that got ported over from DM1 :joy: :100:
They’re going to be everywhere when people transfer over to DM2. Why not just have the module? Or add it to the Marketplace like they did for the HTML Module (which you can download now and use).
I have to say after getting used to the hubl module/custom module thing I totally get the custom module use case vs a hubl. I actually prefer it now looking at my dev's work.
It is definitely better in the long run to go custom module instead of generic hubl module, though when converting a site when it allows a hubl module in DM2 I’m happy with that
(saves work)

I see the use case as well and fully agree custom modules are better with the changes overall long term. That said, my only counter is you’re going to needlessly clutter your custom module folder with little things when you’re just using a tag or two for something basic. You can’t use Hubl in a template without it and a custom module pulls you out to a 2nd tab and module setup when I could just punch it in in 10 seconds. It’s admittedly a minor thing though.
Put simply, I’m happy with both.

yea, the advantage is though, say you add a minor template feature to one page using a hubl module, now the client tells you hey- add that feature to the other templates. Now you have to copy n paste your hubl to all those templates. If you do custom module, it’s as easy as just adding the module in

I hear you. I’d argue it takes the same amount of time to add a hubl module and copy/paste though too. You have to open every single template in that case anyway, but I digress. I’m a fan of Custom Modules.
This is pretty annoying. This is in Firefox on Windows. Looks fine in Chrome.
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.
